CARDINAL . In a letter to the applicants of DATE the Mayor of PERSON allowed the rally , specifying that the laying of wreaths had to take place between CARDINAL and CARDINAL a.m. and the musical programme between TIME and TIME .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Regional Governor of ORG , acting of his own motion and relying on section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW and LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , annulled the Mayor ’s letter . He reasoned that it amounted to an administrative decision , creating legal rights for ORG PIRIN , and that it was unlawful . Firstly , the organisation was not registered ; on the contrary , in DATE ORG had upheld ORG judgment turning down its request to be registered as a political party ( see ORG PIRIN and Others v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL ) , no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , DATE ) . Since it was accordingly unlawful under NORP law , it had no standing to give notice of its intention to hold a rally . Secondly , the proposed rally would put public order at risk . Both ORG and ORG were places visited by many tourists , especially on DATE . It was therefore inappropriate to allow the staging of rallies there . Moreover , rallies and meetings were being organised at those locations at the same time by the local authorities and non - governmental organisations . As clashes between supporters of ORG PIRIN and others had taken place in the past , it was necessary to ban its rally . Finally , the activities of the organisation were contrary to NORP law , as they consisted in propaganda against the country ’s sovereignty and territorial integrity and aroused national and ethnic hatred . The Governor specified that his decision was to be served on the Mayor of PERSON for execution . It was not served on GPE PIRIN or on any of the applicants .

CARDINAL . On DATE the members of the managing board of ORG PIRIN , as well as the first and second applicants , PERSON and PERSON , were summoned by the police . They were issued orders under LAW Ministry of Internal Affairs Act ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) not to organise or take part in the rally in front of PERSON ’s grave near LOC .

CARDINAL . On DATE the third applicant , PERSON , was told by telephone by an employee of the local branch of ORG that no electrical power would be provided for the rally in ORG , as it had been banned by order of the regional governor .

CARDINAL . On DATE a number of drivers of buses hired to transport the participants to the rally in ORG informed the fourth applicant , Mr PERSON , that they could not provide the requested service . PERSON then approached a number of travel agencies in ORG , all of which advised him that the police had apprised them of the regional governor ’s decision and that they would not provide transportation for fear of suffering negative consequences . Mr PERSON eventually managed to hire CARDINAL buses in a nearby village .

CARDINAL . NORP The parties’ accounts of the events of CARDINAL DATE differed somewhat .

CARDINAL . According to the Government , on TIME the transport police carried out routine checks of some of the motor vehicles transporting people to the rally . As the police found certain irregularities , they sanctioned individual drivers and then allowed the buses to proceed to ORG . After that both PERSON and ORG were able to go ahead with the events planned by them , respectively in ORG and near FAC . As required by law , the police dispatched forces to ensure public order during the events . At TIME a group of CARDINAL supporters of ORG laid a wreath and flowers at PERSON grave . PERSON chairman made a short speech , and then the rally continued with a musical programme . No breaches of public order were noted . ORG PIRIN was not allowed to hold a rally in front of FAC . A compromise solution was reached with the organisation to hold the rally in ORG . At TIME CARDINAL members and supporters of ORG PIRIN gathered in front of PERSON monument in ORG . They laid a wreath and flowers . Then the organisation ’s leaders made short speeches about his life and work ; in the ORG ’s view , most of those speeches contained insults against the NORP people and ORG . There were also a number of negative remarks against the police , threats of violence against the Regional Governor and insults against the chairperson of ORG , the Prime Minister and other highranking politicians . The musical programme continued after the allotted time slot . The police did not allow drunk individuals to breach public order . Journalists from “ the former GPE ” interviewed the leaders of ORG and ORG and a number of supporters .

CARDINAL . The applicants started by pointing out that CARDINAL events took place on CARDINAL DATE . The first was the one which their organisation , ORG – PIRIN , held in ORG , in front of PERSON monument . The other was the one held by ORG – a similar but separate organisation – at PERSON ’s grave near FAC . ORG PIRIN ’s members and supporters , including the applicants , were not able to approach the Monastery as originally planned because they were stopped en route by the police . They were allowed to drive only to ORG . They could not tell whether members and supporters of ORG had been allowed to hold a rally near the Monastery .

CARDINAL . The applicants further stressed the difference between the way in which ORG intended to conduct the rally and the way in which it actually unfolded . The original plan was to proceed in the manner described in paragraph CARDINAL above . As a result of ORG decision and the ensuing actions of the police , ORG PIRIN ’s members and supporters were able to go only to ORG . On their way there , CARDINAL buses carrying participants in the rally from ORG were stopped several times by the police , who carried out lengthy checks of the drivers’ and the PERSON papers and imposed penalties for purported violations of the traffic rules . Buses with participants travelling from PERSON to ORG were also stopped by the police CARDINAL times , for TIME each time . The third applicant , PERSON , who was travelling by car , was also stopped by the police , told that the rally was unlawful , and forced to throw away a wreath which he was carrying .

CARDINAL . Upon their arrival in ORG the applicants saw that PERSON monument was surrounded by CARDINAL police officers , who prevented the participants in the rally from laying a wreath , only allowing them to lay flowers individually . The officers also forced the participants to take away ribbons with the inscription “ For Yane – from grateful NORP ” and did not let them make speeches in front of the monument . At TIME the officers advised the bus drivers that if they did not leave ORG in TIME they would be fined .

CARDINAL . The applicants were adamant that no agreement on how to proceed with the rally was ever made between them and the authorities , and that , contrary to what was asserted by the Government , they did not agree to any changes to their original plan . They also pointed out that the ORG ’s allegations that participants in the rally had made offensive speeches and had acted in a disorderly manner were not supported by any evidence .

CARDINAL . Under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the DATE LAW , regional governors ( a ) carry out governmental policy and coordinate the operations of the branches of central government in their respective regions ; ( b ) seek to achieve a balance between national and local interests and interact with the local authorities ; ( c ) are responsible for safeguarding ORG property in their respective regions ; ( d ) uphold legality in their regions and supervise the enforcement of administrative decisions ; ( e ) control the lawfulness of the decisions and the actions of local authorities ; ( f ) coordinate and control the operations of the territorial branches of ministries and other central authorities , as well as the enforcement of their decisions ; ( g ) organise civil defence ; ( h ) preside the regional security councils ; and ( i ) carry out the region ’s international contacts .

CARDINAL . Under LAW CARDINAL Code of Administrative Procedure , all mayoral decisions may be challenged before regional governors . Under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW , regional governors may annul unlawful mayoral decisions . Their decisions to do so are subject to judicial review ( section PERSON ) of the Act ) .

CARDINAL . NORP Regional governors’ decisions , like all administrative decisions , are subject to judicial review by the competent regional administrative courts ( Article CARDINAL § § CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW ) , whose judgments are appealable before ORG ( LAW ) .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the LAW provides that the administrative courts must rule on each application within a reasonable time . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the Code requires the court to deliver its judgment not DATE after the last hearing in the case .

CARDINAL . ORG concluded the examination of application no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ( ORG and PERSON v. GPE ) and application no . CARDINAL ( PERSON and Others v. GPE ) on DATE , by adopting Resolution CM / ResDH(CARDINAL)CARDINAL , which reads , in so far as relevant :

Recalling that the violations of the ORG found by ORG in these cases concern the infringement of the freedom of assembly of organisations which aim to achieve “ the recognition of the NORP minority in GPE ” due to prohibitions of their meetings DATE ( violation of LAW ) and the lack of effective remedies to complain against these prohibitions ( violation of LAW ) ( see details in Appendix ) ;
Recalling that a finding of violations by the ORG requires , over and above the payment of just satisfaction awarded in the judgments , the adoption by the respondent state , where appropriate , of
– individual measures to put an end to the violations and erase their consequences so as to achieve as far as possible restitutio in integrum ; and
– general measures preventing similar violations ;

Having noted that CARDINAL other applications presently pending before the ORG concern allegations relating to bans or to the holding of certain meetings of the applicants initially scheduled DATE and DATE ;

Having considered , without prejudging the judgment the ORG could deliver in respect of these applications , that in view of the positive trend observed concerning the holding of the applicants’ meetings in particular since DATE and the absence of complaints from them as regards DATE , no further individual measure seemed required in these cases ;

Having also examined the general measures and in particular the awarenessraising measures taken by the NORP authorities to ensure that applicable domestic law is interpreted in conformity with the LAW and thus to prevent violations similar to that found by ORG ( see details in Appendix ) ;
Having satisfied itself that , within the time - limit set , the respondent state paid the applicants the just satisfaction provided in the judgments ( see details in Appendix ) ,
DECLARES , having examined the measures taken by the respondent state ( see Appendix ) , that it has exercised its functions under LAW , paragraph CARDINAL , of the LAW in these cases and
DECIDES to close the examination of these cases . ”
